summary: The Expanded Coverage for Former Foster Youth Act amends the Social Security Act to ensure health insurance coverage continuity for former foster youth. It extends Medicaid coverage up to age 26 for individuals who were in foster care at age 18 (or older, as determined by the state), entered kinship guardianship, or were emancipated. The bill also mandates states to establish outreach and enrollment programs to increase enrollment of eligible former foster youth, with a target date of January 1, 2026.
